thread.title: Boy With Down Syndrome Dances To 'Born This Way,' Brings Twitter To Tears
thread.title_full: Boy With Down Syndrome Dances To 'Born This Way,' Brings Twitter To Tears

author: Nina Golgowski
title: Boy With Down Syndrome Dances To 'Born This Way,' Brings Twitter To Tears
text:
Boy With Down Syndrome Dances To 'Born This Way,' Brings Twitter To Tears Ten-year-old Nico rocked out to Lady Gaga's Super Bowl halftime show. 02/06/2017 06:25 pm ET Nina Golgowski Trends reporter, The Huffington Post He was born his way too. #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/3rZsOy1rIA ‚Äî David M. Perry (@Lollardfish) February 6, 2017 
There were a number of empowering moments during Super Bowl Sunday that sparked smiles and even tears. This was one of them. 
A 10-year-old boy who was born with Down syndrome is capturing hearts around the world after he was filmed enthusiastically clapping and dancing to Lady Gaga‚Äôs ‚ÄúBorn This Way‚Äù during the halftime show. 
‚ÄúHe was born his way too,‚Äù Nico‚Äôs father, David Perry, who‚Äôs a Chicago-area disability rights journalist, captioned the 32-second video he posted to Twitter. 
Perry told The Huffington Post that his son ‚Äï who‚Äôs a fan of ‚Äúall kinds of rock and folk music‚Äù ‚Äï had taken a break from watching the football game but ‚Äúcame running upstairs to the TV once he heard the music.‚Äù 
The resulting video easily spread across the web, with viewers cheering on Nico in their response tweets and confessing that it brought tears to their eyes. @Lollardfish Totally made me cry. ‚ù§‚ù§ ‚Äî Lori Hylan-Cho (@WWLoriHC) February 6, 2017 @Lollardfish @SensiblySecular Be right back, gotta go cry my eyes out for a minute, because this is everything üòçüò≠ ‚Äî Ashley Riggs (@Just1MoreAshley) February 6, 2017 @Lollardfish this video made me cry god bless him
